title: Bildad’s Harsh Description of the Wicked
summary: Bildad delivers a scathing speech about the fate of the wicked. Though he doesn't name Job directly, his words are clearly meant for him. He describes the terrifying and total destruction awaiting evil people.

faq.question: What is Bildad’s argument here?
faq.answer: That the wicked always suffer ruin and are forgotten—implying Job is among them.

faq.question: How does Bildad try to persuade Job?
faq.answer: Through fear, describing God’s judgment against the wicked in graphic detail.
